Package com.dr.nlp.sl.datastructure

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Paragraph
    NLP Data Structure - Paragraph Paragraph data structure is created by TextFile and responsible for splitting input string into Sentence(s) using regular expression as sentence boundary: (\.|\?|\!|\."|\.'|\?"|\?'|\!"|\!')\s+[A-Z|"|'] This regular expression will match punctuation at the end of the sentence: .
    Punctuation
    NLP Data Structure - Punctuation Punctuation data structure is created by Sentence and responsible for identifying non-word sentence items such as punctuation.
    Sentence
    NLP Data Structure - Sentence Sentence data structure is created by Paragraph and responsible for splitting input string into SentenceItem(s) items and storing them into array list by using non-word regular expression: "\W" SentenceItem are subclassed into Word(s) and Punctuation(s) This class also implements XMLTagable interface for XML output
    SentenceItem
    Abstract class for sentence items which extend this class and include: Word(s) and Punctuation(s) These items are stored in an array list in the Sentence class
    TextFile
    NLP Data Structure - TextFile TextFile data structure represents a single text file which was read into this program.
    Word
    NLP Data Structure - Word Word data structure is created by Sentence and responsible for identifying words in a sentence.
